summary: This bill, the "Taking Account of Institutions with Low Operation Risk Act of 2025" (TAILOR Act), mandates that federal financial institutions regulatory agencies consider the risk profiles and business models of financial institutions when taking regulatory actions. It requires tailoring regulations to limit burdens on institutions, considering factors like the impact on customer service and third-party service providers. The bill also calls for reports to Congress on regulatory actions and a review of existing regulations. Additionally, it directs the creation of reduced reporting requirements for eligible community banks and a report on modernizing bank supervision.
